greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle T(n,k) whose n-th row lists in increasing order the multinomial coefficients M(n;lambda), where lambda ranges over all partitions of n into distinct parts; n >= 0, 1 <= k <= A000009(n), read by rows.
comment: First row with repeated terms is row 15, see also A309999: 1365 = M(15;11,4) = M(15;12,2,1) and 30030 = M(15;9,5,1) = M(15;10,3,2).
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..45, flattened
example: For n = 5 there are 3 partitions of 5 into distinct parts: [5], [4,1], [3,2].  So row 5 contains M(5;5) = 1, M(5;4,1) = 5 and M(5;3,2) = 10.
maple: [map(x->binomial(n, i)*x, g(n-i, min(n-i, i-1)))[], g(n, i-1)[]]))
mathematica: g[n_, i_] := g[n, i] = If[i(i+1)/2 < n, {}, If[n == 0, {1}, Join[ Binomial[n, i] # & /@ g[n-i, Min[n-i, i-1]], g[n, i-1]]]];
T /@ Range[0, 14] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Jan 27 2021, after _Alois P. Heinz_ *)
xref: Rightmost terms of rows give A290517.
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Aug 26 2019
